title: a SLIGHT change to ARAM...
body:
Make it **actually** _random._


There's no way that ARAM is actually random. There's a Fiddlesticks / Nidalee / Soraka / Lissandra / Ezreal in every single game. I can't even remember the last time I saw a Yorick / Poppy / Diana.

ARAM has the same champions over and over again, there's never any new faces. When I get Tristana THREE games in a row, something's fishy.

replies.body: Rolling 20 on a 20 sided dice 10 times in a row is still random.

technically its pseudo-random, just like how aram is pseudo-random. 
Only way to make aram more "pure" random is to remove the ability to re-roll champs, like how it was at its conception

> [{quoted}](name=Blackflameblade,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=TnJL7FkA,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2015-04-15T16:14:28.736+0000)
>
> technically its pseudo-random, just like how aram is pseudo-random. 
> Only way to make aram more "pure" random is to remove the ability to re-roll champs, like how it was at its conception

There is no such thing as true random from a computer, as there has to be a seed used to generate the number.  If you know the seed and the calculation to get the "Random" number, you can predict it.

Re-rolls don't make it less Random, as the re-roll is a random selection.  It just compensates for a crappy/unwanted roll.

> There is no such thing as true random from a computer

/thread ?

Point is that randomness is impossible to compute.

Well, if the new Mark/Dash summoner spell in ARAM means anything, at least melee champs will have a shot again.
Yeah, because humans are known for being intuitively good with probability and statistics to ascertain randomness without any bias, kappa.

The problem with aram are aram-only accounts and the rerolls.
If you get a not poke champ, you reroll it(or atleast ~90% of the players do so), which ends with pokesetups on both sides in ~80% of the games. If you play anythin besides a hard engage comb or a poke comb, you have problems as you will face a pokecomb, and with out the potential of outlaneing, splitpush or farming, if you can't keep up with the poke you need atleast malphite levels of hardengage to beat a pokecomb.

Back in the days befor rerolls, aram was way more random. You could have great games with udyr as your enemys probably had similar melees like voli on their team, and poke especially early on was reduced alot by not haveing any aditional manasustain and not enough gold to start with the likes of a tear.
Maybe it's because a lot more people have certain champs. The way to make it really random is if players were able to roll any champion, instead of only getting champs they own/are free

I get Diana all the time. I also get Yorick and I see Poppy all the time. The problem is as a human being you have a much different view of "Random" than a computer does. A computer picking a random number out of 1-100 might pick 50, 10 times in a row and that is still COMPLETELY "random". Also as humans we have a tendancy to have selective memory and forget important flaws or facts because our brain is looking for proof of our theory. Famously there is a dancing spiderman gif that looks like he dances to the beat of literally any song when in reality it's just your brain ignoring all the moves he makes that are completely out of tempo or offbeat. I've rolled {{champion:69}}  only 6 times so far this year but I feel like I roll her all the time becuase 2 of those were in the last 4 days.
You can run all the numbers you want, they won't match from day to day

ARAM isn't really all that random, but tbh main reason why you see some picks far more often is because of ARAM smurfs.

I'd like the idea of an ARAM that could let you get a champ you never played before or have owned..hmm...better start a thread for that.
